comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Current 355 Abercrombie St. below. Could be still partly recognisable today - with an additional storey? - from Google Maps Streetview: maps.google.com.au/maps?q=maps+355+abercrombie+st+redfern...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] I think you might have the wrong building and corner.

I wonder what the story is here?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Sands (1888) has Andrew O'Callaghan at Abercrombie Street, Redfern.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The story is the street numbering has changed. Consultation of the Sydney metropolitan detail series maps reveals 355 was at Abercrombie Street's terminus with Golden Grove Street, on the south-east corner. See: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367400.html The building at left with its dormer window still stands (minus its balcony), while only the left most portion of the O'Callaghan building remains. The corner has been hacked away. Google Maps Street View - maps.google.com.au/maps?q=maps+355+abercrombie+st+redfern...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Good work! The building was mutilated for the tramway to Erskineville c.1905. There was a dog-leg (woof!) in the track just here - see the 1907(?) tram map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-db66-sd&rgn=0.... See similar story - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/8746028492/] There will be other strangely-named related photos in Series 4481. They are wonderful photos of 'street life', and bear all the hallmarks of John Degotardi Junior - the classic use of perspective, composition, light, and the featured children. Like The Rocks Resumption photos.
